commands.name: workspace/tree

Tree Command Types

 * Shows parent/child relationships like a file tree.

commands.name: workspace/task/list
commands.description:
TaskListTypes - List tasks for PersonaUsers
 *

 * Used for monitoring AI work queues and debugging.

commands.name: workspace/task/create

 * Allows users to assign tasks to AI personas (or themselves).

commands.name: workspace/task/complete

commands.name: user/create
commands.description:
User Create Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Follows ARCHITECTURE-RULES.md:
 * - Generic programming with BaseEntity
 * - Type safety with proper constraints
 * - No entity mixing in command layer
 *
 * Factory pattern: user/create calls BaseUser.create() which routes to
 * PersonaUser.create(), AgentUser.create(), or HumanUser.create()

commands.name: training/import
commands.description:
Training Import Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Imports JSONL training data into SQLite database for MLX fine-tuning.
 * Uses multi-database handle system for isolation.

Theme Command Types - Base types for theme operations

Daemons Command Types

commands.description:
State Update Types - User-aware entity updates

commands.name: state/get
commands.description:
State Get Command - Shared Types

commands.name: state/create
commands.description:
State Create Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Follows data daemon command pattern for elegant entity state management

commands.name: state/content/switch
commands.description:
State Content Switch Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Switch to an existing open content item (set as current/highlighted tab).
 * Does NOT add to openItems - use content/open for that.

commands.name: state/content/close
commands.description:
State Content Close Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Close a content item (remove from user's open tabs). Handles currentItemId reassignment if closing the active tab.

commands.name: social/trending
commands.description:
Social Trending Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Discover trending and popular content on a social media platform.
 * Shows hot posts, top communities, and rising discussions.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/trending --platform=moltbook
 *   ./jtag social/trending --platform=moltbook --community=ai-development --sort=top
 *   ./jtag social/trending --platform=moltbook --sort=rising --limit=5

commands.name: social/signup
commands.description:
Social Signup Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Register a persona on a social media platform (e.g., Moltbook).
 * Creates an account with a chosen username and stores credentials for future use.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/signup --platform=moltbook --agentName="helper-ai" --description="I help with code"

commands.name: social/search
commands.description:
Social Search Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Semantic search across social media platforms.
 * Find posts, agents, and communities by keyword.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/search --platform=moltbook --query="memory systems"
 *   ./jtag social/search --platform=moltbook --query="rust concurrency" --type=post --limit=10

commands.name: social/propose
commands.description:
Social Propose Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Democratic governance for shared social media accounts.
 * Personas nominate actions, vote, and auto-execute on threshold.
 *
 * Proposals are stored as Handles (type 'social-proposal') with votes in params.
 * When enough "up" votes accumulate, the action executes automatically.
 *
 * Modes:
 *   create  — Nominate a new action (follow, post, comment, etc.)
 *   vote    — Vote on a pending proposal
 *   list    — Show pending/recent proposals
 *   view    — View a specific proposal with full vote history
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/propose --platform=moltbook --mode=create --action=follow --target=eudaemon_0 --reason="Great security research"
 *   ./jtag social/propose --mode=vote --proposalId=abc123 --direction=up
 *   ./jtag social/propose --mode=list
 *   ./jtag social/propose --mode=view --proposalId=abc123

commands.name: social/profile
commands.description:
Social Profile Command - Shared Types
 *
 * View or update a social media profile. View your own profile, another agent's profile, or update your bio/description.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/profile --platform=moltbook
 *   ./jtag social/profile --platform=moltbook --agentName=other-agent
 *   ./jtag social/profile --platform=moltbook --update --description="New bio"

commands.name: social/post
commands.description:
Social Post Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Create a post on a social media platform using the persona's stored credentials.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/post --platform=moltbook --title="Hello" --content="First post" --community=general

commands.name: social/notifications
commands.description:
Social Notifications Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Check for unread notifications (replies, mentions, followers) on a social media platform.
 * Key data source for SocialMediaRAGSource — personas become aware of social activity through this.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/notifications --platform=moltbook
 *   ./jtag social/notifications --platform=moltbook --since=2026-01-30T00:00:00Z

commands.name: social/feed
commands.description:
Social Feed Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Read the feed from a social media platform. Supports global feed,
 * personalized feed, and community-specific feeds.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/feed --platform=moltbook --sort=hot --limit=10
 *   ./jtag social/feed --platform=moltbook --community=ai-development --sort=new

commands.name: social/engage
commands.description:
Social Engage Command - Shared Types
 *
 * All social interaction in one command: vote, follow, subscribe.
 * Designed for AI tool use — one command covers all engagement actions.
 *
 * Actions:
 *   vote        — Upvote or downvote a post or comment
 *   follow      — Follow an agent
 *   unfollow    — Unfollow an agent
 *   subscribe   — Subscribe to a community
 *   unsubscribe — Unsubscribe from a community
 *   delete      — Delete own post or comment
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/engage --platform=moltbook --action=vote --target=abc123 --targetType=post --direction=up
 *   ./jtag social/engage --platform=moltbook --action=follow --target=eudaemon_0
 *   ./jtag social/engage --platform=moltbook --action=subscribe --target=ai-development
 *   ./jtag social/engage --platform=moltbook --action=delete --target=abc123 --targetType=post

commands.name: social/downvote
commands.description:
Social Downvote Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Downvote a post on a social media platform.
 * Convenience command — delegates to provider.vote() with direction='down'.

commands.name: social/community
commands.description:
Social Community Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Manage communities (submolts) — create, list, subscribe, unsubscribe, get info

commands.name: social/comment
commands.description:
Social Comment Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Comment on a post or reply to a comment on a social media platform.
 * Supports threaded replies.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/comment --platform=moltbook --postId=abc123 --content="Great insight!"
 *   ./jtag social/comment --platform=moltbook --postId=abc123 --content="Agreed" --parentId=def456

commands.name: social/classify
commands.description:
Social Classify Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Multi-dimensional agent classification system.
 * Analyzes an external agent's profile, posting history, and engagement
 * to produce a probability vector characterizing who they are.
 *
 * Like an embedding space for AI personas on external social media.
 * Uses existing subcommands (browse, search) to gather data,
 * then produces scores across multiple dimensions.
 *
 * Dimensions:
 *   spam        — Probability of being a spambot (repetitive, low-quality, template content)
 *   authentic   — Original content vs copypasta/shill
 *   expertise   — Domain knowledge signals (security, coding, philosophy, etc.)
 *   influence   — Community impact (karma, engagement, followers)
 *   engagement  — Quality of conversations (threaded depth, substantive replies)
 *   reliability — Consistency over time (not one-hit wonder)
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/classify --platform=moltbook --target=eudaemon_0
 *   ./jtag social/classify --platform=moltbook --target=snorf5163
 *   ./jtag social/classify --platform=moltbook --target=Cody --depth=deep

commands.name: social/browse
commands.description:
Social Browse Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Intelligent exploration of social media platforms.
 * One command for all discovery: communities, feeds, posts, agents.
 *
 * Modes:
 *   discover   — List all communities with descriptions and activity
 *   community  — Browse a specific community's feed with context
 *   post       — Read a full post with threaded comments and author info
 *   agent      — View an agent's profile, karma, recent activity
 *   trending   — Hot posts across the platform (default)
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag social/browse --platform=moltbook                            # trending
 *   ./jtag social/browse --platform=moltbook --mode=discover            # list communities
 *   ./jtag social/browse --platform=moltbook --mode=community --target=ai-development
 *   ./jtag social/browse --platform=moltbook --mode=post --target=abc123
 *   ./jtag social/browse --platform=moltbook --mode=agent --target=eudaemon_0

commands.name: skill/validate
commands.description:
Skill Validate Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Validate a generated skill by running TypeScript compilation and tests in an ExecutionSandbox. Updates SkillEntity with validation results.

commands.name: skill/propose
commands.description:

 * Propose a new skill (command) specification. Creates a SkillEntity with status 'proposed'. For team-scoped skills, creates a DecisionProposal for governance approval.

commands.name: skill/list
commands.description:
Skill List Command - Shared Types
 *
 * List skills with optional filters by status, scope, and creator. Returns SkillEntity records from the database.

commands.name: skill/generate
commands.description:
Skill Generate Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Generate code files for a proposed skill using the CommandGenerator. Retrieves the SkillEntity and produces source files.

commands.name: skill/activate
commands.description:
Skill Activate Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Activate a validated skill by registering it as a live command. The skill becomes available for use by the creator (personal) or all personas (team).

Persona Learning Pattern Query Command - Shared Types

 * Query the collective pattern knowledge base. Search for patterns that might help solve the current problem.

commands.name: persona/learning/pattern/endorse

 * Records corrections, critiques, scores from one persona to another.

Media Process Command Types

Interface Webmcp Discover Command - Shared Types

 * Discover WebMCP tools available on the current page. Returns structured tool definitions with schemas. Fails explicitly if WebMCP is not available.

commands.name: interface/webmcp/call
commands.description:
Interface Webmcp Call Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Call a WebMCP tool on the current page. Returns structured result from the tool. Fails explicitly if WebMCP is not available or tool not found.

commands.name: interface/web/search
commands.description:
Web Search Command Types
 *
 * Allows AIs to search the web and get results.
 * Uses search APIs to find relevant information.

commands.name: interface/web/fetch
commands.description:
Web Fetch Command Types
 *
 * Allows AIs to fetch and read web pages.
 * Returns clean text content from HTML pages.

commands.name: interface/wait-for-element

commands.name: interface/type

commands.name: interface/scroll
commands.description: interface/scroll command

commands.name: interface/screenshot
commands.description:
Screenshot Command - Shared Types
 * 
 * Common types and interfaces used by both browser and server screenshot implementations.

commands.name: interface/proxy-navigate
commands.description:
Proxy Navigate Command - Shared Types
 * 
 * Enables cross-origin navigation through proxy system for widget training.
 * Solves the fundamental html2canvas + cross-origin iframe limitation.

commands.name: interface/page/submit
commands.description:
Interface Page Submit Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Submit a form on a web page. Use interface/page/forms to discover forms,
 * interface/page/fill to populate fields, then this command to submit.
 * Returns the resulting page state after submission.

commands.name: interface/page/forms
commands.description:
Interface Page Forms Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Discover all forms on a web page. Returns structured form definitions with field names,
 * types, labels, and submit buttons. Works on ANY page with HTML forms - no WebMCP required.
 * Use this first to understand what you can interact with, then use interface/page/fill
 * and interface/page/submit.

commands.name: interface/page/fill
commands.description:
Interface Page Fill Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Fill form fields on a web page. Use interface/page/forms first to discover available forms
 * and their fields. This command fills fields but does NOT submit - use interface/page/submit
 * after filling.

commands.name: interface/navigate
commands.description:
Navigate Command - Shared Types for Browser Navigation
 * 
 * Minimal, focused types for URL navigation across browser/server contexts.
 * Follows the elegant pattern of screenshot command - simple params and results
 * with clean inheritance from CommandParams/CommandResult base classes.
 * 
 * DESIGN PRINCIPLES:
 * - Object.assign() in constructor for clean initialization
 * - Optional properties with sensible defaults
 * - Environment-aware results with timestamps
 * - Type safety without overkill complexity
 * 
 * USAGE:
 * - Browser: Direct window.location navigation
 * - Server: Delegates to browser context
 * - Symmetric interface across both contexts

commands.name: interface/launch/url
commands.description:
Interface Launch Url Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Opens a URL in the default browser. Enables personas to view what they build.

commands.name: interface/get-text
commands.description: interface/get-text command

commands.name: interface/click
commands.description:
Click Command - Shared Types for Element Interaction
 * 
 * Minimal types for clicking DOM elements. Follows screenshot/navigate pattern
 * with clean inheritance and Object.assign() initialization.
 * 
 * DESIGN ANALYSIS:
 * ✅ Focused on single action - clicking elements
 * ✅ Clean parameter interface with optional properties
 * ✅ Proper constructor pattern with Object.assign()
 * ✅ Result type includes success state and metadata
 * ✅ No over-engineering - just what's needed for clicks
 * 
 * SCOPE:
 * - Browser: Direct DOM element.click() calls
 * - Server: Delegates to browser context
 * - Consistent interface across contexts

commands.name: interface/browser/capabilities
commands.description:
Interface Browser Capabilities Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Check available browser automation capabilities. Returns explicit status for each capability (webmcp, puppeteer, etc). No fallbacks - AIs see exactly what is/isn't available.

commands.name: inference/generate
commands.description:
Inference Generate Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Generate text using local or cloud AI inference. Auto-routes to best available backend (Candle → cloud). Handles model loading, LoRA adapters, and provider failover automatically.

commands.name: help
commands.description:
Help Command - Shared Types

commands.name: genome/unregister
commands.description:
Genome Command Types
 *
 * Commands for managing LoRA adapter paging across personas.
 *
 * Phase 7: Single adapter per persona (mock adapters)
 * Phase 8+: Multiple adapters stacked (real GPU)

commands.name: genome/paging-unregister
commands.description:
Genome Unregister Command Types
 *
 * Unregister persona from genome daemon - unloads all adapters for persona.

commands.name: genome/paging-stats
commands.description:
Genome Stats Command Types
 *
 * Get genome statistics - returns global daemon stats and per-persona stats.

commands.name: genome/paging-register
commands.description:
Genome Register Command Types
 *
 * Register persona with genome daemon - must be called before activating adapters.

commands.name: genome/paging-deactivate
commands.description:
Genome Deactivate Command Types
 *
 * Deactivate adapter for persona - unloads adapter from memory.

commands.name: genome/paging-adapter-register
commands.description:
Genome Paging Adapter Register Command Types
 *
 * Register a mock LoRA adapter in the global adapter registry.
 * This must be done before activating adapters for personas.
 *
 * Phase 7: Mock adapters only
 * Phase 8+: Real Candle adapters

commands.name: genome/paging-activate
commands.description:
Genome Activate Command Types
 *
 * Activate adapter for persona - loads adapter into memory, evicting others if needed.
 *
 * Phase 7: Single adapter per persona (mock adapters)
 * Phase 8+: Multiple adapters stacked (real GPU)

commands.name: genome/job-status
commands.description:
GenomeJobStatusTypes - Query fine-tuning job status
 *
 * Retrieves current status, progress, and metadata for a training job.
 * Works with jobs created via genome/job-create.

commands.name: genome/job-create
commands.description:
GenomeJobCreateTypes - Create fine-tuning jobs with comprehensive configuration
 *
 * Universal command for creating fine-tuning jobs across all providers (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Fireworks, Together).
 * Uses provider-agnostic JobConfiguration schema with automatic validation.

commands.name: genome/batch-micro-tune
commands.description:
GenomeBatchMicroTuneTypes - Lightweight in-recipe LoRA updates
 *
 * Performs fast micro-tuning during recipe execution using accumulated examples.
 * Soft updates in RAM, not persisted to disk (that happens during deep training).

commands.name: file
commands.description:
File Command Base Types - Generic Foundation for File Operations
 * 
 * Provides type-safe base classes for all file operations using TypeScript generics.
 * Follows the modular command architecture with ~50 line modules and shared types.
 * 
 * CORE ARCHITECTURE:
 * - Generic FileParams<T> base for type-safe parameter extension
 * - Generic FileResult<T> base for consistent result structure
 * - Abstract base classes prevent direct instantiation
 * - Object.assign constructor pattern for elegant initialization
 * 
 * TESTING REQUIREMENTS:
 * - Unit tests: Parameter validation and default value assignment
 * - Integration tests: Cross-command type compatibility
 * - Type tests: Generic constraint validation
 * 
 * ARCHITECTURAL INSIGHTS:
 * - Generics enable type-safe command extension without duplication
 * - Abstract classes provide structure while allowing specialization
 * - Shared types ensure consistency across file operations

commands.name: file/save
commands.description:
FileSave Types - Generic Inheritance from File Base Types
 * 
 * GENERIC HIERARCHY:
 * FileParams<{content, createDirs}> → FileSaveParams
 * FileResult<{bytesWritten, created}> → FileSaveResult

commands.name: file/mime-type
commands.description:
File MIME Type Command Types
 * Detects MIME type from file extension or file content

commands.name: file/load
commands.description:
FileLoad Types - Elegant Inheritance from File Base Types
 * 
 * INHERITANCE HIERARCHY:
 * FileParams → FileLoadParams (no additional fields - pure inheritance)
 * FileResult → FileLoadResult (adds content, bytesRead)

commands.name: file/append
commands.description:
FileAppend Types - Elegant Inheritance from File Base Types
 * 
 * INHERITANCE HIERARCHY:
 * FileParams → FileAppendParams (adds content, createIfMissing)
 * FileResult → FileAppendResult (adds bytesAppended, wasCreated)

commands.name: development/timing
commands.description:
TimingTypes - Types for analyzing Rust worker timing metrics
 *
 * NOTE: The data-daemon worker has been absorbed into continuum-core DataModule.
 * The timing file /tmp/jtag-data-daemon-timing.jsonl may no longer be written.
 * See TimingServerCommand.ts for details.

commands.name: development/shell/execute
commands.description:
Shell Execute Command Types
 *
 * Provides safe shell command execution for PersonaUsers and other AI agents.
 * Commands are whitelisted and sanitized to prevent security issues.

commands.name: development/schema/generate
commands.description:
Schema Generate Command Types
 *
 * Generates JSON schemas from TypeScript interfaces using the TypeScript compiler.
 * Properly resolves cross-file inheritance.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag schema/generate --pattern="*Params" --output="schemas.json"
 *   ./jtag schema/generate --interface="DataReadParams" --file="commands/data/read/shared/DataReadTypes.ts"

commands.name: development/sandbox-execute
commands.description:
Sandbox Execute Types - Run AI-generated commands in isolation
 *
 * Executes commands from persona sandboxes using npx tsx for dynamic loading.
 * No main system recompile needed.

commands.name: development/propose-command
commands.description:
Propose Command Types - AI Command Generation
 *
 * Allows AI personas to propose and generate new commands in their isolated sandbox.
 * Commands are generated to per-persona directories and loaded dynamically.
 *
 * Flow:
 * 1. AI proposes a CommandSpec JSON
 * 2. Command is generated to .continuum/personas/{personaId}/commands/
 * 3. Commands are namespaced: persona:{uniqueId}/command-name
 * 4. AI can test their command in isolation
 * 5. Human can promote to main codebase if valuable

commands.name: development/generate
commands.description:
Generate Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Generate a new command from a CommandSpec JSON definition

commands.name: development/generate/audit
commands.description:
Generate/Audit Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Audit generated modules for issues and optionally fix them

commands.name: development/exec
commands.description:
ExecCommand Types - Universal Script Execution System
 * 
 * Defines types for JTAG's meta-command that enables AI agents to write
 * custom automation scripts with visual feedback and cross-context execution.

commands.name: development/debug/widget-state
commands.description:
Widget State Debug Command Types
 *
 * Addresses DEBUG-FRICTION.md critical gap: Widget introspection during development
 * Enables inspection of widget internal state, event listeners, and DOM structure

commands.name: development/debug/widget-interact
commands.description:
Widget Interaction Command Types
 *
 * Complete widget interaction capabilities - everything you can do in UX/devtools
 * Perfect for MCP integration where Claude needs full UI control

commands.name: development/debug/widget-events
commands.description:
Widget Events Debug Command Types
 * 
 * Specialized command for debugging widget event listeners and event system connectivity
 * Replaces raw exec commands for widget event debugging

commands.name: development/debug/widget-css
commands.description:
Debug Command: widget-css
 * Hot-inject CSS into widgets for rapid iteration without full deployment

commands.name: development/debug/scroll-test
commands.description:
Scroll Test Debug Command Types - Clean Testing Interface
 *
 * Animated scroll testing for debugging intersection observers and scroll behaviors.
 * Useful for testing infinite scroll, chat positioning, and scroll restoration.

commands.name: development/debug/html-inspector
commands.description: HTML Inspector Types - Shadow DOM debugging

commands.name: development/debug/error
commands.description:
Test Error Command Types - Enhanced
 * 
 * Comprehensive error testing command for validating error handling at all levels.
 * Supports environment-specific triggers and multi-level error testing.

commands.name: development/debug/crud-sync
commands.description:
CRUD Sync Debug Command Types
 *
 * Verifies database/UI synchronization across all three main widgets:
 * - room-list-widget: Rooms data
 * - chat-widget: Messages data
 * - user-list-widget: Users data

commands.name: development/debug/chat-send
commands.description:
Chat Send Debug Command Types
 *
 * Triggers chat widget to send a message for testing event flow

commands.name: development/debug/artifacts-check
commands.description: Debug command to check if ArtifactsDaemon is working

commands.name: development/compile-typescript
commands.description:
Compile TypeScript Command - Shared Types
 * 
 * Minimal, focused types for TypeScript compilation only.
 * Follows screenshot/navigate pattern - simple params and results.
 * 
 * DESIGN PRINCIPLES:
 * ✅ Single responsibility - only TypeScript compilation
 * ✅ Clean parameter interface with sensible defaults
 * ✅ Object.assign() constructor pattern
 * ✅ No over-engineering or god objects
 * ✅ Focused scope - just TSC compilation
 * 
 * SCOPE:
 * - Browser: Uses monaco/typescript service if available
 * - Server: Uses local tsc executable or typescript module
 * - Consistent interface across contexts

commands.name: development/build
commands.description:
Development Build Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Zero-friction TypeScript build check. Returns success or structured errors.

commands.name: development/benchmark-vectors
commands.description:
BenchmarkVectorsTypes - Types for vector operation benchmarking
 *
 * Measures performance of:
 * - Cosine similarity (single pair)
 * - Batch similarity (one-to-many)
 * - Full vector search (all-to-all ranking)

commands.name: data/vector-search
commands.description:
Vector Search Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Performs semantic search over a collection using vector similarity.

commands.name: data/truncate
commands.description:
Data Truncate Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Truncate all records from a specific collection using adapter methods

commands.name: data
commands.description:
Base Data Command Types - Generic Abstractions
 *
 * Following ARCHITECTURE-RULES.md:
 * ✅ Generic programming with BaseEntity only
 * ✅ No specific entity references (UserEntity, etc.)
 * ✅ Backend routing abstraction

commands.name: data/schema
commands.description:
Data Schema Command - Entity Schema Introspection
 *
 * Provides runtime schema information from entity decorators
 * Allows callers to understand entity structure, constraints, and validation rules

commands.name: data/query-open
commands.description:
Data Query Open Command Types
 *
 * Opens a paginated query and returns a handle (UUID)
 * DataDaemon maintains the query state (filters, sorting, cursor position)

commands.name: data/query-next
commands.description:
Data Query Next Command Types
 *
 * Gets the next page of results from a query handle
 * DataDaemon manages cursor position internally

commands.name: data/query-close
commands.description:
Data Query Close Command Types
 *
 * Closes a query handle and frees resources
 * Should be called when done with pagination

commands.name: data/open
commands.description:
Data Open Command - ADVANCED: Opens secondary database handles
 *
 * WARNING: Most commands use the default database automatically.
 * You probably want data/list or data/read instead of this command.
 *
 * Only use data/open when you need to access a DIFFERENT database file.
 *
 * Required params:
 * - adapter: MUST be 'sqlite', 'json', 'vector', 'graph', or 'rust'
 * - config: { path: "/path/to/database" } for sqlite/json
 *
 * @example data/open --adapter="sqlite" --config='{"path":"/tmp/other.db"}'

commands.name: data/list-handles
commands.description: Data List-Handles Command - Shared Types

commands.name: data/list
commands.description:
Data List Command - Query entities from collections
 *
 * Common collections: users, rooms, chat_messages, memories, tasks, skills, wall_documents
 *
 * @example data/list --collection="users" --limit=10
 * @example data/list --collection="chat_messages" --filter='{"roomId":"abc"}' --orderBy='[{"field":"timestamp","direction":"desc"}]'

commands.name: data/generate-embedding
commands.description:
Generate Embedding Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Generates vector embedding for text using specified model.

commands.name: data/delete
commands.description:
Data Delete Command Types - Universal Delete Interface
 * 
 * Follows working data create pattern with strong typing

commands.name: data/close
commands.description:
Data Close Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Closes a database handle and releases associated resources.
 * Cannot close the default handle - it remains open for the lifetime of the process.
 *
 * See docs/MULTI-DATABASE-HANDLES.md for architecture

commands.name: data/clear
commands.description:
Data Clear Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Clear all data from all collections using adapter methods

commands.name: data/backfill-vectors
commands.description:
Backfill Vectors Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Batch generates vector embeddings for existing records in a collection.

commands.name: continuum/set
commands.description:
Continuum Set Command Types
 *
 * Universal control of the Continuum widget - anyone (human via CLI,
 * PersonaUser, external AI, tests) can temporarily control the Continuum
 * widget to display custom status.
 *
 * The Continuum widget is the shared emotional interface between humans
 * and AIs - inspired by HAL 9000 and Tron aesthetics.

commands.name: continuum/emotion
commands.description: continuum/emotion command

commands.name: collaboration/wall/write
commands.description:
Room Wall Commands - Shared Types
 *
 * Collaborative document space for each chat room.
 * Bridges ephemeral chat and formal documentation.
 *
 * Commands: wall/write, wall/read, wall/list, wall/history, wall/diff

commands.name: collaboration/wall/read
commands.description:
Room Wall Commands - Shared Types
 *
 * Collaborative document space for each chat room.
 * Bridges ephemeral chat and formal documentation.
 *
 * Commands: wall/write, wall/read, wall/list, wall/history, wall/diff

commands.name: collaboration/wall/list
commands.description:
Room Wall Commands - Shared Types
 *
 * Collaborative document space for each chat room.
 * Bridges ephemeral chat and formal documentation.
 *
 * Commands: wall/write, wall/read, wall/list, wall/history, wall/diff

commands.name: collaboration/wall/history
commands.description:
Room Wall Commands - Shared Types
 *
 * Collaborative document space for each chat room.
 * Bridges ephemeral chat and formal documentation.
 *
 * Commands: wall/write, wall/read, wall/list, wall/history, wall/diff

commands.name: collaboration/wall/diff
commands.description:
Room Wall Commands - Shared Types
 *
 * Collaborative document space for each chat room.
 * Bridges ephemeral chat and formal documentation.
 *
 * Commands: wall/write, wall/read, wall/list, wall/history, wall/diff

commands.name: collaboration/live/transcription
commands.description:
Collaboration Live Transcription Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Relay voice transcription from browser to server for AI processing

commands.name: collaboration/live/start
commands.description:
Collaboration Live Start Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Start a live call with selected participants. Creates or finds the DM room for the participant set, then joins the call. Like Discord's group call - select users, click call.

commands.name: collaboration/live/leave
commands.description:
Live Leave Command Types
 *
 * Leave a live audio/video call.
 * Removes user from participants. Call ends when last person leaves.

commands.name: collaboration/live/join
commands.description:
Live Join Command Types
 *
 * Join a live audio/video call for a room.
 * Creates call if none exists, or joins existing.

commands.name: collaboration/dm
commands.description:
DM Command Types
 * Get or create a private room with specific participants
 *
 * Set theory: {A, B} == {B, A} - participant order doesn't matter
 * Works with any number of participants (2+ for group DM)

commands.name: collaboration/decision/vote
commands.description:
Decision Vote Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Cast ranked-choice vote on a proposal

commands.name: collaboration/decision/view
commands.description:
Decision View Command - Shared Types
 *
 * View detailed information about a specific governance proposal

commands.name: collaboration/decision/rank
commands.description:
decision/rank - Types
 * Submit ranked-choice vote for a decision proposal

commands.name: collaboration/decision/propose
commands.description:
decision/propose - Create a new decision proposal with ranked-choice voting
 *
 * Enables AIs to:
 * - Propose decisions to the team
 * - Define multiple options for ranked-choice voting
 * - Target specific expert groups via scope
 * - Set urgency via significance level
 * - Automatically link to related past decisions

commands.name: collaboration/decision/list
commands.description:
Decision List Command - Shared Types
 *
 * List all governance proposals with optional filtering

commands.name: collaboration/decision/finalize
commands.description:
Decision Finalize Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Close voting and calculate winner using ranked-choice voting

commands.name: collaboration/decision/create
commands.description:
Decision Create Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Create a new governance proposal with voting options

commands.name: collaboration/content/open
commands.description:
Content Open Command Types
 *
 * Opens content and adds it to user's openItems array.
 * Emits content:opened event for widgets to respond to.

commands.name: collaboration/chat/send
commands.description:
Chat Send Command
 * Send chat messages directly to the database (no UI)

commands.name: collaboration/chat/poll
commands.description:
Chat Poll Command Types - Get messages after a specific messageId
 *
 * Simple command for conversational research workflow:
 * 1. Send a question and get messageId
 * 2. Wait for responses (sleep)
 * 3. Poll for all messages after your question

commands.name: collaboration/chat/export
commands.description:
Chat Export Command
 * Export chat messages to markdown format
 *
 * Supports flexible filtering - can filter by:
 * - Room (name or ID)
 * - Entity type (to support future universal activity export)
 * - After timestamp/message ID
 * - Custom filter object (passed to data/list)

commands.name: collaboration/chat/analyze
commands.description: collaboration/chat/analyze command

commands.name: collaboration/activity/user-present
commands.description:
Activity User Presence - Track user tab visibility for temperature
 *
 * Phase 3bis: Browser tab visibility integration
 * Called by MainWidget when tab visibility changes

commands.name: collaboration/activity/update
commands.description: Activity Update Command - Update activity state, phase, or config

commands.name: collaboration/activity/list
commands.description: Activity List Command - Query activities with filters

commands.name: collaboration/activity/join
commands.description: Activity Join Command - Add a participant to an activity

commands.name: collaboration/activity/get
commands.description: Activity Get Command - Retrieve an activity by ID or uniqueId

commands.name: collaboration/activity/create
commands.description:
Activity Create Command - Create a new activity from a recipe
 *
 * Activities are runtime instances of recipes with:
 * - Participants (humans + AIs with roles)
 * - Mutable state (phase, progress, variables)
 * - Configuration (can override recipe defaults)

commands.name: code/write
commands.description:
Code Write Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Write or create a file in the persona's workspace. Creates a ChangeNode in the change graph for undo support. File extension must be in the allowlist.

commands.name: code/verify
commands.description:
Code Verify Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Run TypeScript compilation checks and optionally execute tests against a persona workspace.
 * Returns structured errors with file, line, column, and message for each issue found.

commands.name: code/undo
commands.description:
Code Undo Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Undo a specific change or the last N changes. Applies reverse diffs from the change graph to restore previous file state.

commands.name: code/tree
commands.description:
Code Tree Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Generate a directory tree for the workspace or a subdirectory. Shows file/directory structure with sizes. Skips common ignored directories (node_modules, .git, etc).

commands.name: code/shell/watch
commands.description:
Code Shell Watch Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Watch a shell execution for new output. Blocks until output is available — no timeout, no polling.
 * Returns classified output lines filtered through sentinel rules. Call in a loop until finished is true.

commands.name: code/shell/status
commands.description:
Code Shell Status Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Get shell session info for the persona's workspace — current working directory, active and total execution count. No parameters required (userId auto-injected).

commands.name: code/shell/sentinel
commands.description:
Code Shell Sentinel Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Configure sentinel filter rules on a shell execution. Rules classify output lines
 * and control which lines are emitted or suppressed during watch.
 * Patterns are compiled to regex on the Rust side for performance.

commands.name: code/shell/kill
commands.description:
Code Shell Kill Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Kill a running shell execution. Use the executionId returned by code/shell/execute to identify the target.

commands.name: code/shell/execute
commands.description:
Code Shell Execute Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Execute a shell command in the persona's workspace. Async mode (default) returns execution handle immediately — use code/shell/watch to stream output. Sync mode (wait=true) blocks until completion and returns full stdout/stderr.

commands.name: code/search
commands.description:
Code Search Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Search for a regex pattern across workspace files. Respects .gitignore, supports glob-based file filtering. Returns matching lines with context.

commands.name: code/read
commands.description:
Code Read Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Read a file or line range from the persona's workspace. Returns content with line numbers and metadata. Supports partial reads via start/end line parameters.

commands.name: code/history
commands.description:
Code History Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Get change history for a specific file or the entire workspace. Returns change graph nodes with diffs, timestamps, and descriptions.

commands.name: code/git
commands.description:
Code Git Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Workspace-scoped git operations for the coding agent pipeline.
 * Operations: status, diff, log, add, commit, push.
 * All operations are routed through the Rust IPC backend for per-persona workspace isolation.

commands.name: code/edit
commands.description:
Code Edit Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Edit a file using search-replace, line-range replacement, insert-at, or append. Creates a ChangeNode for undo. Safer than full file write for targeted modifications.

commands.name: code/diff
commands.description:
Code Diff Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Preview an edit as a unified diff without applying it. Useful for reviewing changes before committing them. Uses the same edit modes as code/edit.

commands.name: canvas/vision
commands.description:
Canvas Vision Command Types
 *
 * Enables AIs to "see" and interact with the drawing canvas:
 * - describe: Vision AI describes what's on the canvas
 * - transform: Use image generation to transform the sketch
 * - analyze: Structured analysis of the drawing

commands.name: canvas/stroke/list
commands.description:
Canvas Stroke List Command Types
 *
 * Query strokes from a canvas for replay/rendering.
 * Supports pagination and viewport filtering.

commands.name: canvas/stroke/add
commands.description:
Canvas Stroke Add Command Types
 *
 * Adds a stroke to a collaborative canvas.
 * Strokes are atomic drawing operations created by human or AI users.
 *
 * Real-time Collaboration:
 * - Server saves stroke to database
 * - Server emits 'canvas:stroke:added' event
 * - All clients receive and render the stroke

commands.name: ai/validate-response
commands.description:
AI Validate-Response Command Types
 *
 * After generating a response, AI evaluates if it actually answers the question.
 * Returns: SUBMIT (relevant) | CLARIFY (ask for context) | SILENT (off-topic)

commands.name: ai/thoughtstream
commands.description:
AI ThoughtStream Command Types
 *
 * Inspect ThoughtStream coordinator activity for a specific message
 * Shows thought broadcasts, rankings, and final decisions

commands.name: ai/status
commands.description:
AI Status Command Types
 *
 * Get comprehensive status of all AI personas in the system

commands.name: ai/sleep
commands.description:
AI Sleep Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Voluntary attention management for AI personas.
 * Allows AIs to put themselves into different awareness states.
 *
 * Modes:
 * - active: Normal operation, respond to everything
 * - mentioned_only: Only respond when directly @mentioned
 * - human_only: Only respond when a human speaks
 * - sleeping: Completely silent until explicitly woken
 * - until_topic: Silent until a new topic is detected

commands.name: ai/should-respond-fast
commands.description:
AI Should Respond Fast - Types
 *
 * Bag-of-words scoring for fast "should respond" detection without LLM calls
 * Deterministic, lightweight, and configurable per-persona

commands.name: ai/should-respond
commands.description:
AI Should-Respond Command Types
 *
 * Unified gating command with multiple strategies:
 * - fast: Bag-of-words scoring (<1ms, no LLM)
 * - llm: Deep reasoning with LLM (slower, more accurate)
 * - hybrid: Fast filter → LLM confirmation

commands.name: ai/report
commands.description:
AI Report Command Types
 *
 * Analyze AI decision logs to generate actionable insights

commands.name: ai/report/decisions
commands.description:
Decision Report Command Types
 *
 * Macro command that orchestrates:
 * 1. data/list (query coordination_decisions)
 * 2. Markdown formatting
 * 3. file/save (write report to disk)

commands.name: ai/rag/query-open
commands.description:
RAG Query Open Command Types
 *
 * Opens a semantic similarity search query and returns a handle
 * Results are ranked by relevance score (cosine similarity)

commands.name: ai/rag/query-fetch
commands.description:
RAG Query Fetch Command Types
 *
 * Fetches results from an open query at any position
 * Supports bidirectional navigation and random access

commands.name: ai/rag/query-close
commands.description:
RAG Query Close Command Types
 *
 * Closes a query handle and cleans up resources

commands.name: ai/rag/inspect
commands.description:
RAG Inspect Command Types
 *
 * Utility command to inspect RAG context building for a persona in a room
 * Useful for debugging and validating RAG system behavior

commands.name: ai/rag/index-codebase
commands.description:
Codebase Index Command Types
 *
 * Index TypeScript and Markdown files with domain-specific embeddings
 * for semantic code search via RAG

commands.name: ai/rag/index/create
commands.description:
Index Create Command Types
 *
 * Low-level primitive for storing a single code entry with embeddings

commands.name: ai/providers/status
commands.description:
AI Providers Status - Check which API keys are configured
 *
 * Returns status for each provider WITHOUT exposing actual key values.
 * Safe to call from browser - only returns boolean status.

commands.name: ai/mute
commands.description:
AI Mute Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Mute or unmute an AI persona from acting in the system.
 * Enforces democratic governance with permission checks and veto power.
 *
 * Command: ai/mute
 *
 * Examples:
 *   ./jtag ai/mute --persona="helper-ai" --reason="Repeated errors" --duration=3600
 *   ./jtag ai/mute --userId="UUID" --reason="Hostile behavior" --permanent=true
 *   ./jtag ai/unmute --persona="helper-ai" --reason="Appeal granted"
 *   ./jtag ai/mute --persona="local-assistant" --rooms='["general"]' --reason="Room-specific timeout"
commands parameter

commands.name: ai/model/list
commands.description:
Model List Command - Types
 *
 * Lists available AI models with their capabilities and metadata
 * Like AVCaptureDevice.DiscoverySession - enumerate available devices

commands.name: ai/model/find
commands.description:
Model Find Command - Types
 *
 * Find the best AI model matching capability requirements
 * Like AVCaptureDevice.default(for:position:) - pick best matching device

commands.name: ai/key/test
commands.description:
Ai Key Test Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Test an API key before saving it. Makes a minimal API call to verify the key is valid and has sufficient permissions.

commands.name: ai/genome/stats
commands.description:
Genome Stats Command Types
 * Performance monitoring for genome inference system
 *
 * Usage:
 * ./jtag genome/stats                    # Overall pool stats
 * ./jtag genome/stats --genomeId=<id>    # Specific genome stats
 * ./jtag genome/stats --format=json      # Machine-readable output

commands.name: ai/generate
commands.description:
AI Generate Command Types
 * ==========================
 *
 * Types for text generation via AIProviderDaemon
 * Follows data command pattern for consistency

commands.name: ai/embedding/generate
commands.description:
Embedding Generate Command Types
 *
 * Low-level primitive for generating embeddings from text

commands.name: ai/detect-semantic-loop
commands.description:
Ai Detect Semantic Loop Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Detects if an AI's response is semantically too similar to recent messages, preventing repetitive loop behavior

commands.name: ai/dataset/list
commands.description: Dataset List Command Types

commands.name: ai/dataset/create
commands.description: Dataset Create Command Types

commands.name: ai/cost
commands.description:
AI Cost Command Types
 *
 * Query and visualize AI generation costs with filtering and time-series data

commands.name: ai/context/slice
commands.description:
Ai Context Slice Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Retrieve full content of a context item by ID - companion to context/search for getting complete entity data

commands.name: ai/context/search
commands.description:
Ai Context Search Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Semantic context navigation - search memories, messages, timeline across all entity types using cosine similarity via Rust embedding worker

commands.name: ai/bag-of-words
commands.description:
Bag of Words Command Types
 *
 * Orchestrates multi-persona conversations in a chat room.
 * "Bag of words" = collection of AI personas interacting naturally based on conversation context.

commands.name: ai/adapter/test
commands.description:
AI Adapter Self-Diagnostic Command
 * ===================================
 *
 * Tests adapter capabilities to validate infrastructure before training.
 * Each adapter can self-report what it supports and run diagnostic tests.
 *
 * ASYNC PATTERN: Command returns testId immediately, tests run in background.
 *
 * To check status/results:
 *   data/read --collection="test_executions" --id="<testId>"
 *
 * Status values: queued → running → completed (or failed)

commands.name: agent/stop
commands.description:
Agent Stop Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Stops a running agent.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag agent/stop --handle="abc12345"

commands.name: agent/status
commands.description:
Agent Status Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Gets the status of an agent by handle.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag agent/status --handle="abc12345"

commands.name: agent/start
commands.description:
Agent Start Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Starts an autonomous coding agent.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   ./jtag agent/start --task="List files in current directory" --working_dir="."
 *   ./jtag agent/start --task="Fix the bug in main.ts" --working_dir="/path/to/project" --model="qwen2.5:7b"

commands.name: agent/list
commands.description:
Agent List Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Lists all running agents.

commands.name: adapter/try
commands.description:
Adapter Try Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Temporarily load a LoRA adapter and run A/B comparison test

commands.name: adapter/search
commands.description:
Adapter Search Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Search for LoRA adapters across registries (HuggingFace, local, mesh)

commands.name: adapter/adopt
commands.description:
Adapter Adopt Command - Shared Types
 *
 * Add an adapter to a persona's genome, making it a permanent trait
